column5: We (Joey Tier)  found mud, yes mud, on the trail to the first lake, so we headed back to an easy-access lake. There, we found 1" of solid ice, so we fished off a public dock into 4 feet of water and caught nothing.  Ice fishing!
I'm still jealous that you two got to do that, so that's saying something.
Yep, that's pretty sad Jer, hahaha. Are the lakes completely open in your area?

Who needs ice when you have open water? I know it's just not the same. Nothing like coming into the hut for a hot bowl of Chile and a cold pop. I had the hardwater bug for many years and I get it. Good effort boys.
Last pic is priceless.  I wish we had that here. Would of been out on open water, if not for the wind.

I went up and checked the progress today with Sam.  if not for the snow, you could have launched a boat there.  Just a skim or shore ice on some back bays.  To say I am disappointed is an understatement!  Nice day for a drive with my girlfriend at least.
This kind of shore open water-ice fishing allow to use 2 rods or not?
Yep. And I can't really get out on a kayak. Kinda risky biz.
Beats sitting at home!!  Exactly!  I saw a lot of people sitting around over the holidays.  Looks like the snow is going to bugger up the ice making up there.  Looks like a fun day to me.
HaHa! At least you gave it a shot. Nominate this " best thread of 2016" so far.
